info.title: SA Card Code
info.description:
# Introduction
 The Programmable Card API is a programmatic endpoint that manages Private Banking and Corporate Investment Banking cards. This API allows you to access and manage the following:
- Cards
- Deploy code
- Run simulations
- Manage environmental variables
- Retrieve merchant codes
- Retrieve currencies
- Retrieve countries
 # Getting Started
To start using the Programmable Card API, you’ll need API credentials, which you can access in your [Investec Online Banking](https://login.secure.investec.com) profile. Create a new API key (x-api-key) with specified API scopes. Remember to include the *cards* scope

## Run with Postman
[Open the collection in postman](https://www.postman.com/investec-open-api/workspace/programmable-banking/collection/26868804-00260d55-0009-42ee-b148-d439992e64ff?action=share&creator=26868804)  
or fork  
[![Run in Postman](https://run.pstmn.io/button.svg)](https://god.gw.postman.com/run-collection/26868804-00260d55-0009-42ee-b148-d439992e64ff?action=collection%2Ffork&collection-url=entityId%3D26868804-00260d55-0009-42ee-b148-d439992e64ff%26entityType%3Dcollection%26workspaceId%3D905c2bab-81a1-4297-8b70-2456c776a7a0)

The instructions below will guide you through the process of authenticating in the Postman app: 
1. Set the verb to POST and enter the auth URL [https://openapi.investec.com/identity/v2/oauth2/token](https://openapi.investec.com/identity/v2/oauth2/token) as the request URL.
2. The endpoint receives your client ID and client secret as [BASIC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BASIC) authentication headers. Select the Authorization tab and select BASIC AUTH from the Type list.
3. Enter your client_ID into the USERNAME field and your secret into the PASSWORD field 
4. Select the Headers tab and enter the “x-api-key” into the KEY field
5. Enter your API key into the VALUE field
6. Select the Body tab and select the x-www-form-urlencoded option
7. Enter grant_type into the KEY field and client_credentials into the VALUE field.
8. Send off your request.

If your keys are valid, the response will contain an access token and the number of seconds the access token is valid. 
Sample response:
```json
{
    "access_token": "Z1CRQarGOSogNuUhRlENi5iKAGqh”,
    "token_type": "Bearer",
    "expires_in": 1799,
    "scope": "accounts"
}
```

# Authentication
1. OAuth 2.0 access tokens are used to authenticate requests. Your access token authorises you to use the Programmable Card API.
2. To call the API, you must exchange your client ID, secret and API (x-api-key) key for an access token. 
3. You need to include the access token in the Authorisation header with the designation bearer when making calls to the API
4. The access token returned during the authentication request is valid for 30 minutes, at which point it will expire, and you will need to request a new one by calling /identity/v2/oauth2/token again.

When you make calls to the API, include the access token in the Authorisation header with the designation as Bearer. 
<SecurityDefinitions />

tags.name: Card management
tags.description: Get a list of cards as well as retrieving the card information. Also included is the ability to create virtual cards

tags.name: Card code management
tags.description: Retrieve and maintain the code on the specific card, including testing and viewing logs

tags.name: Card environmental variables
tags.description: Retrieve and maintain the user defined environmental variables. Note: the variables are read-only when the card code is executed

tags.name: Toggle
tags.description: Ability to toggle whether the code on the card will be executed

tags.name: Reference data
tags.description: Utility endpoints that expose the reference data that contained in the response data

get.description: Obtain cards associated with the account.

x-code-samples.label: cURL
x-code-samples.source:
curl --location 'https://openapi.investec.com/za/pb/v1/cards' 
 --header 'Authorization: Bearer {yourBearerToken}'

x-code-samples.label: HTTP

400.description: Bad Request - The requested operation will not be carried out

401.description: Unauthorized - The requested operation was refused access

403.description: Forbidden - Not permitted to make this request

429.description: Too Many Requests - To many requests in quick succession, Retry the request.

500.description: Internal Server Error - The requested operation failed to execute

post.description: Create a virtual card associated with the specified account.

x-code-samples.label: cURL
x-code-samples.source:
curl --location 'https://openapi.investec.com/za/v1/cards' 
 --header 'Content-Type: application/json' 
 --header 'Authorization: Bearer {yourBearerToken}' 
 --data '{
"AccountNumber": "{accountNumber}",
"EmbossName" : "CardEmbossName",
"EmbossName2" : "CardEmbossName2"
}'

x-code-samples.label: HTTP

get.description: Retrieve card detail excluding sensitive information.

parameters.name: cardKey
parameters.description: The CardKey obtained from the get cards call.

x-code-samples.source:
curl --location 'https://openapi.investec.com/za/pb/v1/cards/212121' 
 --header 'Authorization: Bearer {yourBearerToken}'

x-code-samples.label: HTTP

401.description: Unauthorized - The requested operation was refused access

403.description: Forbidden - Not permitted to make this request

post.description:
Get the detail of a card including full card number, cvv and expiry date
Note on usage 
- In order to retrieve sensitive information on the card you have to supply details regarding a RSA Public key that gets created client side. We will encrypt the sensitive information at the lowest level with the specified public key information.  
- In order to view the information in the extended property you would need to decrypt it with the Private key created in the preceding step.  

| Area                   | Value     |
| :------                | :-------  |
| Encryption Algorithm   | RSA       |
| Key Size               | 2048      |

parameters.name: cardKey
parameters.description: The CardKey obtained from the get cards call.

parameters.name: extended
parameters.description: Set to true in to retrieve extended sensitive card information

x-code-samples.label: cURL
x-code-samples.source:
curl --location 'https://openapi.investec.com/za/v1/cards/212121?extended=true' 
 --header 'Content-Type: application/json' 
 --header 'Authorization: Bearer {yourBearerToken}' 
 --data '{
"AccountNumber": "{accountNumber}",
"EmbossName" : "CardEmbossName",
"EmbossName2" : "CardEmbossName2"
}'

x-code-samples.label: HTTP

identifier.description: What you identify your key with

appName.description: App name of the application that generate the RSA Key Pair

post.summary: Update Function Code (Without publishing to card)
post.description: Save specified code to the specific card. Note: This allows you to save/stage the code to the card without publishing it. This implies that the code will not execute when a card transaction occurs.

parameters.name: cardKey
parameters.description: The CardKey obtained from the get cards call.

post.description: Publish specified code to the specific card. *Note: This will mark the saved code as the published code ready for execution. Remember to specify the {codeid} obtained from the Get Function (saved) code.

parameters.name: cardKey
parameters.description: The CardKey obtained from the get cards call.

x-code-samples.label: cURL
HTTP

post.description: Publish specified code to the specific card. Note: This allows you to push code to the specified card. After successfully publishing the code it will execute the next time a card transaction occurs.

parameters.name: cardKey
parameters.description: The CardKey obtained from the get cards call.

x-code-samples.label: cURL
x-code-samples.source:
curl --location 'https://openapi.investec.com/za/v1/cards/{cardKey}/code/execute' 
 --header 'Authorization: Bearer {yourBearerToken}' 
 --header 'Content-Type: application/json' 
 --data '{
"simulationcode": "// This function runs during the card transaction authorization flow.\n// It has a limited execution time, so keep any code short-running.\nconst beforeTransaction = async (authorization) => {\n    console.log(authorization);\n    return true;\n};\n\n// This function runs after a transaction.\nconst afterTransaction = async (transaction) => {\n    console.log(transaction)\n};",
"centsAmount": "10000",
"currencyCode": "zar",
"merchantCode": 5462,
"merchantName": "The Coders Bakery",
"merchantCity": "Cape Town",
"countryCode": "ZA"
}'

x-code-samples.label: HTTP
x-code-samples.source:
POST /za/v1/cards/{cardKey}/code/execute HTTP/1.1 
Host: openapi.investec.com 
Authorization: Bearer {yourBearerToken}
Content-Type: application/json
{
"simulationcode": "// This function runs during the card transaction authorization flow.\n// It has a limited execution time, so keep any code short-running.\nconst beforeTransaction = async (authorization) => {\n    console.log(authorization);\n    return true;\n};\n\n// This function runs after a transaction.\nconst afterTransaction = async (transaction) => {\n    console.log(transaction)\n};",
"centsAmount": "10000",
"currencyCode": "zar",
"merchantCode": 5462,
"merchantName": "The Coders Bakery",
"merchantCity": "Cape Town",
"countryCode": "ZA"
}
